conclusion: Utilize the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Define ΔU as change in internal energy, Q as heat absorbed, W as work done.
The work done by the gas is W = 10 J.
Line segment AB is parallel to the V-axis, indicating constant pressure.
The process from A to B is an isobaric process.
For an isothermal process, ΔU = 0 because internal energy depends only on temperature.
Substitute ΔU = 0 and W = 10 J into the first law: 0 = Q - 10 J.
Rearrange to solve for Q: Q = 10 J.
